result.execSummary:
The defendant Deena M Curiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deena M Curiel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Deena M Curiel
Current: 106 S Swetting St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2016)
Prior: 198 S Adams Ave, Berlin, WI 54923
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Dave at GLSO.
from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

10:29 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

$150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:34 a.m.

1:35 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeanne Zamzow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - was provided discovery but do not have an offer.  Court sets for status hearing on July 21, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:35 p.m.

1:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - is trying for a Public Defender.  Court will set for status hearing on June 1, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
No Violent Contact with Rigoberto T.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No Violent Contact with Rigoberto T.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

3:04 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant requests to waiver her right to counsel and meet with the DA.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant request counsel.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Rigoberto T.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:07 p.m.
